title: Zed: High-performance AI Code Editor
author: vquemener
aiHeadline: Introducing Zed, the AI-powered code editor that promises to make you look like a coding wizard, because who doesn't want to write code faster than a caffeinated squirrel?

title: Ty: A fast Python type checker and language server
author: arathore
aiHeadline: Ty arrives to save Python developers from the horrors of type errors, because apparently, we're all just toddlers when it comes to data types.

title: CLion Is Now Free for Non-Commercial Use
author: AlexeyBrin
aiHeadline: CLion is now free for non-commercial use, which is basically JetBrains saying, 'We know you can't afford us, so here's a gift—now go code something awesome and don't tell your boss.'

title: Unity’s Open-Source Double Standard: the ban of VLC
author: cempaka
aiHeadline: Unity bans VLC from its open-source projects, proving once again that open-source is only as open as the company's mood swings.

title: Waiting for Postgres 18: Accelerating Disk Reads with Asynchronous I/O
author: lfittl
aiHeadline: Postgres 18 is on its way, and it's bringing asynchronous I/O to speed up disk reads, which is like finally getting a car with a working accelerator after years of driving with the parking brake on.
